div.p: Greetings. I wanted to respond more fully to your letter written on April 4th, most esteemed lord; however, with the messenger in haste, I am now unable to do so, being hindered by a certain relative of mine, who, when I had already begun to write, distracted me for nearly 3 hours. Meanwhile, as I said, the messenger is preparing to leave, so I can now give nothing more than this enclosed note, which I had previously arranged to be written, so that I could insert it into the letter as soon as the messenger was offered, or, if he were delayed, add more. At the same time, I give you great thanks for writing to me so diligently about the tumult of the Rhaetians.
Given at Augsburg, April 23, in the year 1572.
Your most observant, Georg von Stetten. To the reverend, pious, and learned lord Heinrich Bullinger, most vigilant Antistes of the Church of Zurich, his esteemed lord and friend.
